96: 1. Set up the scrabble board and arrange all the tiles.
2. Shuffle the tiles and place them face down.
3. Each player picks seven tiles from the shuffled pile.
4. Determine who goes first by drawing a tile from the pile. The person with the letter closest to the beginning of the alphabet goes first.
5. The first player starts by forming a word on the board using their available tiles, making sure the word connects with at least one existing tile.
6. Each subsequent player takes their turn by either adding onto existing words or creating new words with their tiles.
7. Players earn points based on the value of the letters they use and the positions on the board.
8. The game continues until all the tiles have been used or no players can make a valid word. The player with the highest score wins.
